body.name: Avella VH501 Video Tripod System,72 inch Professional Heavy Duty Aluminum Tripod, with Detachable Fluid Drag Pan Tilt Head Max Loading 13.2 LB, for Canon Nikon Sony Olympus Panasonic DSLR Camcorder
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
features: Avella camera tripod adopt aluminum alloy construction, excellent in durability and stability. As a professional video tripod, the max diameter of the tripod is 16mm, and the max load capacity can up to 13.2 pounds. When you add a flash or a battery grip to your camera in the future, or shoot with a heavier cameraequipment, 13.2 pounds max load will help you avoid the collapses of the whole thing, and avoid destroying your camera and lens.

tripod system including a fluid drag video head features a tilt range of 90 degrees forward and 80 degrees back, head pans 360°making it possible for you to shoot action photos,2 Sections detachable handle can be installed on the left or right side according to your needs. The safety lock protects your camera from accidents at all times and the built-in horizontal bubble helps to adjust the level.
Flip Lock Button: large and stable clips ensure the best clamping of the tripod legs. 3 sections aluminum , which allows the tripod’s height adjustable from 85cm/33inch to 182cm/72inch.

WIDE COMPATIBILITY & EXCELLENT WARRANTY-Ball head with 3/8" screw hole, can be installed on the monopod directly; The quick release plate with 1/4" screw, suit for most cameras, such as Canon Nikon Sony Pentax Panasonic Olympus Casio Kodak Ricoh Sigma GoPro Fujifilm Kodak DSLR Mirorrless Camera Fotocamera & DV.
13.2 lb Load Capacity | 33" to 72" Height Range | Tilt Angle +90° / -50° | 360° Panning | 60mm Ball Diameter | Carrying Bag | Fluid Head | Tripod Leg | 2 pcs of Quick Release Plates .

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Video Tripod System, Avella VH501 72 inch- Professional Heavy Duty Aluminum Twin Tube Tripod Avella Tripod provides different kinds of photography equipment. VH501 Tripod is a good choice for photographers, enthusiasts, beginners, and travelers with light weight and high quality. From 33’’ to 72’’ Flexible Adjustment. Maximum height (72 inches) allows you to take photos of distance landscapes with ease. Folded height (35 inches) makes it easy to carry for outdoors.V501 fluid head tripod weighs only 1.87 lbs and supports up to 13.2 lbs. Smooth movements combined with an advanced balancing system.Versatile - Offers 360° panning, tilt angle adjustments from +90° to -50°. Provides fixed fluid drag in both the pan and tilt axes An integrated bubble level on the head aids you in quickly leveling the fluid head.Includes separate locks for pan and tilt functions, a built-in bubble level indicator, which helps in aligning the horizon line and a gear driven center columnThe sliding quick release plate with a standard 1/4"-20 mounting screw on the top, and a spare 3/8" screw includedInterchangeable pan bar handle, with angular adjustment, fits on both left and right of head for convenient user control.its length can be adjusted from 27.5cm ~ 40.5cm. Note: Camera not included.

This VH501 tripod can support slider and camera less than 13.2 pounds. And the 3/8” extended interface can be connected the monitor, slider, jib or crane. Professionally and widely used in wedding party, TV filming, live broadcasting, etc. This VH501 professional tripod offers excellent stability with the two-tube design, perfect for rugged cameras and heavy loads camcorder.

VH501 Tripod Leg Material: Aluminum Sections: 3 Max. Operating Height: 72" / 1820mm Min. Operating Height: 33" / 845mm Folded Length: 35.2"/895mm Diameter (bowl): 2.36" / 60mm Loading Capacity: 13.2 lbs / 6kg Net Weight: 10lbs / 4.6kg

Middle Spreader The mid-level sling is useful for increasing the stability of the tripod, which also provides stable support when working on uneven surfaces. Diameter (bowl):2.36" / 60mm base plate under the fluid damping head screwing with 3/8 screw, and match with the 60mm ball box,locking the lock bulb . Fluid Head Quick Release Plate: Yes, with a 1/4" screw and one spare 3/8" screw Tilt range: -50° to +90° Pan range: 360° Friction Control: Fixed Bubble level: Yes Diameter (bowl): 2.36"/60mm Tilt Lock: Yes Pan Lock: Yes Pan Handle: Yes The built-in ball joint enables the Quick Flip Leg Lock Featuring flip-type locks on the tripod, it is easy to adjust the height by locking and loosening the locks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. We ordered this tripod and it came damaged. The center part of the tripod was broken. They sent a new one and it was good. I would recommend this any day. It is light and sturdy. Good price as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Big Bargain So Far
reviews.reviewText: I have to say it took a lot of thought and studying the reviews of these before pulling the trigger on my need for two of them, but I did and they seem really a decent bargain for how much they will be used. I have some Manfrottos that are a similar form factor, but they were quite a bit more money (double? triple?) and have held up OK and I have hopes for these as well. These get taller than my Manfrottos, too.I didn't see any of the problems that other reviewers have reported.A huge bonus to me is that they came in what seem to be decent quality carrying bags, and each on had two quick-release plates with them. The hugeness of the bonus is that the plates also fit my Manfrotto stands/heads, so it won't matter which camera has which plate. I very much appreciate that.The one weak-seeming part to me is the way the handle attaches to the head does not seem to tighten very tight on the handle, making it easy to rotate when it should be solid. I think I'll be able to figure something out for that, and these will mostly be for assistants to use, so I'll only be vicariously aggravated if they do rotate. Some applications won't need to use the handles.I like them so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bang for buck
reviews.reviewText: It's not Manfrotto but it doesn't have to be at 1/5th the cost.I'd take 5 of these over 1 Manfrotto any day... oh wait, I have.Had one arrive over-tight and the Pan-head jumped a bit every 10th of a rotation but this was easily fixed by loosening the screw a bit.I do a lot of multi-cam broadcast and my gear tends to get beat up by operators of variable experience levels. With a bit of maintenance from time to time even my oldest Avella 501 is still working fine. The cross brace is a bit flimsy and you have to watch for lost screws there... that's my only real complaint.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good tripod for big lenses
reviews.reviewText: Good tripod for big lenses. I use a lense to take moon photos and it is easily set up, is sturdy and has smooth and fluid movement. The tilt and pan has an easy lockup/tightening mechanism when you need to "set your shot". For the price it's a great tripod, but it has it's limits. I still use a remote to fire the shutter on my camera to avoid any movement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent for the money, but there are a couple of caveats.
reviews.reviewText: ***Mind the tension settings on the leg locks, esp the lower legs that you don't use in most situations. A Torx 15 wrench fits them and they are not adjusted when you get them, so the locks can be slip if you haven't set them up properly. It's easy to do, just be aware it of this.***I got this to use with a Lumix DSLR and it is the right size and weight for that camera. It extends to about 72" in two leg sections and is sturdy and with its flip locks on the legs set up is quick. Leveling ball head (with bubble level) is nice and the pan and tilt work but are not up to the grade of a mid-range tripod as far as smoothness. Drag is not adjustable, there's just a lock off on both pan and tilt, which makes precision moves tricky to say the least.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible bang for the buck
reviews.reviewText: Great tripod, amazing quality for the price. I teach film/video production and I need tripods that can stand up to student abuse. This tripod is amazing; well built, easy to use, easy to level and really sturdy. The carrying case is great and the fact that it comes with two mounting plates is a real bonus. I now have four of them and they are awesome. These are not ultra light but I want a tripod to be a solid base and a little bit of extra weight is actually a plus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid and smooth
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased two of these - using for church work, getting better results than with lower-end (flimsier) tripods. These are NOT flimsy! Fluid head lets pans and tilts be executed with almost imperceptible smoothness.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AWESOME tripod for the price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to use with my Lumix G9 for video shoots and I could not be happier. No, I'm not a professional - just a hobbyist and YouTuber. But for my needs it's terrific. Super easy to level, very smooth on the pan and tilt, and well balanced.VERY happy. 5 stars all the way.
